moderate Regular Expression Denial of Service
  • Module: semver
  • Published: October 17th 2015
  • Reported by: Adam Baldwin
  • CWE-400
  • CVE-2015-8855
  • Vulnerable: <4.3.2
  • Patched: >=4.3.2
  • Exploitability: 3

Overview

Versions 4.3.1 and earlier of semver are affected by a regular expression denial of service vulnerability when extremely long version strings are parsed.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>semver
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>update-notifier>semver-diff>semver

Remediation

Update to version 4.3.2 or later

References

  • Regular Expression Denial of Service - OWASP

low Incorrect Handling of Non-Boolean Comparisons During Minification
  • Module: uglify-js
  • Published: October 17th 2015
  • Reported by: Tom MacWright
  • CWE-95
  • CVE-2015-8857
  • Vulnerable: <= 2.4.23
  • Patched: >= 2.4.24
  • Exploitability: 2

Overview

Versions of uglify-js prior to 2.4.24 are affected by a vulnerability which may cause crafted JavaScript to have altered functionality after minification.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>handlebars>uglify-js

Remediation

Upgrade UglifyJS to version >= 2.4.24.

References

  • Backdooring JS - Yan Zhu(@bcrypt)
  • Issue #751

More about this vulnerability
low Regular Expression Denial of Service
  • Module: uglify-js
  • Published: October 24th 2015
  • Reported by: Adam Baldwin
  • CWE-400
  • CVE-2015-8858
  • Vulnerable: <2.6.0
  • Patched: >=2.6.0
  • Exploitability: 3

Overview

Versions of uglify-js prior to 2.6.0 are affected by a regular expression denial of service vulnerability when malicious inputs are passed into the parse() method.

Proof of Concept

var u = require('uglify-js');
var genstr = function (len, chr) {
    var result = "";
    for (i=0; i<=len; i++) {
        result = result + chr;
    }

    return result;
}

u.parse("var a = " + genstr(process.argv[2], "1") + ".1ee7;");

Results

$ time node test.js 10000
real    0m1.091s
user    0m1.047s
sys    0m0.039s

$ time node test.js 80000
real    0m6.486s
user    0m6.229s
sys    0m0.094s

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>handlebars>uglify-js

Remediation

Update to version 2.6.0 or later.

More about this vulnerability
high Cross-Site Scripting
  • Module: handlebars
  • Published: December 14th 2015
  • Reported by: Matias P. Brutti
  • CWE-79
  • CVE-2015-8861
  • Vulnerable: <4.0.0
  • Patched: >=4.0.0
  • Exploitability: 7

Overview

Versions of handlebars prior to 4.0.0 are affected by a cross-site scripting vulnerability when attributes in handlebar templates are not quoted.

Proof of Concept

Template: <a href={{foo}}/>

Input: { 'foo' : 'test.com onload=alert(1)'}

Rendered result: <a href=test.com onload=alert(1)/>

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>handlebars

Remediation

Update to version 4.0.0 or later. Alternatively, ensure that all attributes in handlebars templates are encapsulated with quotes.

References

  • SourceClear - Handlebars Research Findings
  • PR #1083

More about this vulnerability
moderate Regular Expression Denial of Service
  • Module: hawk
  • Published: January 19th 2016
  • Reported by: Adam Baldwin
  • CWE-400
  • CVE-2016-2515
  • Vulnerable: < 3.1.3 || >= 4.0.0 <4.1.1
  • Patched: >=3.1.3 < 4.0.0 || >=4.1.1
  • Exploitability: 5

Overview

Versions of hawk prior to 3.1.3, or 4.x prior to 4.1.1 are affected by a regular expression denial of service vulnerability related to excessively long headers and URI's.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>bower-registry-client>request>hawk
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>request>hawk

Remediation

Update to hawk version 4.1.1 or later.

References

Issue #168

More about this vulnerability
critical Potential Command Injection
  • Module: shell-quote
  • Published: May 16th 2016
  • Reported by: Koki Takahashi, Jon Lamendola, Nick Starke, Jacob Waddell
  • CWE-77
  • CVE-2016-10541
  • Vulnerable: <=1.6.0
  • Patched: >=1.6.1
  • Exploitability: 8

Overview

Affected versions of shell-quote do not properly escape command line arguments, which may result in command injection if the library is used to escape user input destined for use as command line arguments.

Proof of Concept:

The following characters are not escaped properly: >,;,{,}

Bash has a neat but not well known feature known as "Bash Brace Expansion", wherein a sub-command can be executed without spaces by running it between a set of {} and using the , instead of to seperate arguments. Because of this, full command injection is possible even though it was initially thought to be impossible. 

   const quote = require('shell-quote').quote;
   console.log(quote(['a;{echo,test,123,234}']));
   // Actual                    "a;{echo,test,123,234}"
   // Expected                  "a\;\{echo,test,123,234\}"
   // Functional Equivalent     "a; echo 'test' '123' '1234'"

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>shell-quote

Remediation

Update to version 1.6.1 or later.

More about this vulnerability
high Regular Expression Denial of Service
  • Module: minimatch
  • Published: May 25th 2016
  • Reported by: Nick Starke
  • CWE-400
  • CVE-2016-10540
  • Vulnerable: <=3.0.1
  • Patched: >=3.0.2
  • Exploitability: 4

Overview

Affected versions of minimatch are vulnerable to regular expression denial of service attacks when user input is passed into the pattern argument of minimatch(path, pattern).

Proof of Concept

var minimatch = require(“minimatch”);

// utility function for generating long strings
var genstr = function (len, chr) {
  var result = “”;
  for (i=0; i<=len; i++) {
    result = result + chr;
  }
  return result;
}

var exploit = “[!” + genstr(1000000, “\\”) + “A”;

// minimatch exploit.
console.log(“starting minimatch”);
minimatch(“foo”, exploit);
console.log(“finishing minimatch”);

Findings

  • grunt>findup-sync>glob>minimatch
  • grunt>glob>minimatch
  • grunt>minimatch
  • gulp>vinyl-fs>glob-stream>glob>minimatch
  • gulp>vinyl-fs>glob-stream>minimatch
  • gulp>vinyl-fs>glob-watcher>gaze>globule>glob>minimatch
  • gulp>vinyl-fs>glob-watcher>gaze>globule>minimatch
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>glob>minimatch
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>glob>minimatch

Remediation

Update to version 3.0.2 or later.

More about this vulnerability
moderate Remote Memory Exposure
  • Module: request
  • Published: February 1st 2017
  • Reported by: Feross Aboukhadijeh
  • CWE-201
  • CVE-2017-16026
  • Vulnerable: >=2.2.6 <2.47.0 || >2.51.0 <=2.67.0
  • Patched: >=2.68.0
  • Exploitability: 2

Overview

Affected versions of request will disclose local system memory to remote systems in certain circumstances. When a multipart request is made, and the type of body is number, then a buffer of that size will be allocated and sent to the remote server as the body.

Proof of Concept

var request = require('request');
var http = require('http');

var serveFunction = function (req, res){
    req.on('data', function (data) {
            console.log(data)
        });
    res.end();
};
var server = http.createServer(serveFunction);
server.listen(8000);

request({
    method: "POST",
    uri: 'http://localhost:8000',
    multipart: [{body:500}]
},function(err,res,body){});

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>request

Remediation

Update to version 2.68.0 or later

References

  • PR #2018
  • Issue #1904

More about this vulnerability
high Regular Expression Denial of Service
  • Module: tough-cookie
  • Published: September 8th 2017
  • Reported by: Cristian-Alexandru Staicu
  • CWE-400
  • CVE-2017-15010
  • Vulnerable: <2.3.3
  • Patched: >=2.3.3
  • Exploitability: 5

Overview

Affected versions of tough-cookie are susceptible to a regular expression denial of service.

The amplification on this vulnerability is relatively low - it takes around 2 seconds for the engine to execute on a malicious input which is 50,000 characters in length.

If node was compiled using the -DHTTP_MAX_HEADER_SIZE however, the impact of the vulnerability can be significant, as the primary limitation for the vulnerability is the default max HTTP header length in node.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>insight>tough-cookie

Remediation

Update to version 2.3.3 or later.

References

  • Issue #92

More about this vulnerability

More about this vulnerability
moderate Prototype Pollution
  • Module: hoek
  • Published: April 20th 2018
  • Reported by: HoLyVieR
  • CWE-471
  • CVE-2018-3728
  • Vulnerable: <= 4.2.0 || >= 5.0.0 < 5.0.3
  • Patched: > 4.2.0 < 5.0.0 || >= 5.0.3
  • Exploitability: 5

Overview

Versions of hoek prior to 4.2.1 and 5.0.3 are vulnerable to prototype pollution.

The merge function, and the applyToDefaults and applyToDefaultsWithShallow functions which leverage merge behind the scenes, are vulnerable to a prototype pollution attack when provided an unvalidated payload created from a JSON string containing the __proto__ property.

This can be demonstrated like so:

var Hoek = require('hoek');
var malicious_payload = '{"__proto__":{"oops":"It works !"}}';

var a = {};
console.log("Before : " + a.oops);
Hoek.merge({}, JSON.parse(malicious_payload));
console.log("After : " + a.oops);

This type of attack can be used to overwrite existing properties causing a potential denial of service.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>bower-registry-client>request>hawk>boom>hoek
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>request>hawk>boom>hoek
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>bower-registry-client>request>hawk>cryptiles>boom>hoek
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>request>hawk>cryptiles>boom>hoek
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>bower-registry-client>request>hawk>hoek
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>request>hawk>hoek
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>bower-registry-client>request>hawk>sntp>hoek
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>request>hawk>sntp>hoek

Remediation

Update to version 4.2.1, 5.0.3 or later.

References

  • HackerOne Report

More about this vulnerability
low Prototype Pollution
  • Module: lodash
  • Published: April 24th 2018
  • Reported by: Olivier Arteau (HoLyVieR)
  • CWE-471
  • CVE-2018-3721
  • Vulnerable: <4.17.5
  • Patched: >=4.17.5
  • Exploitability: 1

Overview

Versions of lodash before 4.17.5 are vulnerable to prototype pollution.

The vulnerable functions are 'defaultsDeep', 'merge', and 'mergeWith' which allow a malicious user to modify the prototype of Object via __proto__ causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.

Findings

  • grunt-karma>lodash
  • grunt-contrib-uglify>lodash
  • grunt>findup-sync>lodash
  • grunt>grunt-legacy-log>grunt-legacy-log-utils>lodash
  • grunt>grunt-legacy-log>lodash
  • grunt>grunt-legacy-util>lodash
  • grunt>lodash
  • gulp>vinyl-fs>glob-watcher>gaze>globule>lodash
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>inquirer>lodash
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>insight>inquirer>lodash
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>lodash

Remediation

Update to version 4.17.5 or later.

References

  • HackerOne Report

More about this vulnerability
moderate Memory Exposure
  • Module: tunnel-agent
  • Published: April 24th 2018
  • Reported by: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
  • CWE-20
  • Vulnerable: <0.6.0
  • Patched: >=0.6.0
  • Exploitability: 3

Overview

Versions of tunnel-agent before 0.6.0 are vulnerable to memory exposure.

This is exploitable if user supplied input is provided to the auth value and is a number.

Proof-of-concept:

require('request')({
  method: 'GET',
  uri: 'http://www.example.com',
  tunnel: true,
  proxy:{
    protocol: 'http:',
    host:'127.0.0.1',
    port:8080,
    auth:USERSUPPLIEDINPUT // number
  }
});

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>bower-registry-client>request>tunnel-agent
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>request>tunnel-agent

Remediation

Update to version 0.6.0 or later.

References

  • GitHub Commit #9ca95ec
  • Proof of Concept

More about this vulnerability
moderate Regular Expression Denial of Service
  • Module: underscore.string
  • Published: December 7th 2018
  • Reported by: Cristian-Alexandru Staicu
  • CWE-400
  • Vulnerable: <=3.3.4
  • Patched: >=3.3.5
  • Exploitability: 4

Overview

Versions of underscore.string prior to 3.3.5 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS).

The function unescapeHTML is vulnerable to ReDoS due to an overly-broad regex. The slowdown is approximately 2s for 50,000 characters but grows exponentially with larger inputs.

Findings

  • grunt>grunt-legacy-log>grunt-legacy-log-utils>underscore.string
  • grunt>grunt-legacy-log>underscore.string
  • grunt>grunt-legacy-util>underscore.string
  • grunt>underscore.string
  • grunt>js-yaml>argparse>underscore.string

Remediation

Upgrade to version 3.3.5 or higher.

References

  • GitHub Issue

More about this vulnerability
critical Prototype Pollution
  • Module: handlebars
  • Published: December 28th 2018
  • Reported by: Mahmoud Gamal, Matías Lang
  • CWE-471
  • Vulnerable: <=4.0.13 || >=4.1.0 <4.1.2
  • Patched: >=4.0.14 <4.1.0 || >=4.1.2
  • Exploitability: 6

Overview

Versions of handlebars prior to 4.0.14 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. Templates may alter an Objects' prototype, thus allowing an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the server.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>handlebars

Remediation

For handlebars 4.1.x upgrade to 4.1.2 or later. For handlebars 4.0.x upgrade to 4.0.14 or later.

More about this vulnerability
high Symlink Arbitrary File Overwrite
  • Module: bower
  • Published: January 30th 2019
  • Reported by: skyn3t
  • CWE-59
  • Vulnerable: <1.8.8
  • Patched: >=1.8.8
  • Exploitability: 7

Overview

Versions of bower prior to 1.8.8 are affected by an arbitrary file write vulnerability. The vulnerability occurs because bower does not verify that extracted symbolic links do not resolve to targets outside of the extraction root directory.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower

Remediation

Update to version 1.8.8 or later

References

  • HackerOne Report
  • Node.js Security-wg

More about this vulnerability
high Arbitrary File Overwrite
  • Module: decompress-zip
  • Published: January 30th 2019
  • Reported by: Snyk Security Team
  • CWE-22
  • Vulnerable: <0.2.2 || >=0.3.0 <0.3.2
  • Patched: >=0.2.2 <0.3.0 || >=0.3.2
  • Exploitability: 7

Overview

Vulnerable versions of decompress-zip are affected by the Zip-Slip vulnerability, an arbitrary file write vulnerability. The vulnerability occurs because decompress-zip does not verify that extracted files do not resolve to targets outside of the extraction root directory.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>decompress-zip

Remediation

For decompress-zip 0.2.x upgrade to 0.2.2 or later. For decompress-zip 0.3.x upgrade to 0.3.2 or later.

References

  • Snyk Report
  • Node.js Security-wg

More about this vulnerability
high Prototype Pollution
  • Module: lodash
  • Published: February 13th 2019
  • Reported by: asgerf
  • CWE-471
  • CVE-2018-16487
  • Vulnerable: <4.17.11
  • Patched: >=4.17.11
  • Exploitability: 3

Overview

Versions of lodash before 4.17.5 are vulnerable to prototype pollution.

The vulnerable functions are 'defaultsDeep', 'merge', and 'mergeWith' which allow a malicious user to modify the prototype of Object via {constructor: {prototype: {...}}} causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.

Findings

  • grunt-karma>lodash
  • grunt-contrib-uglify>lodash
  • grunt>findup-sync>lodash
  • grunt>grunt-legacy-log>grunt-legacy-log-utils>lodash
  • grunt>grunt-legacy-log>lodash
  • grunt>grunt-legacy-util>lodash
  • grunt>lodash
  • gulp>vinyl-fs>glob-watcher>gaze>globule>lodash
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>inquirer>lodash
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>insight>inquirer>lodash
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>lodash

Remediation

Update to version 4.17.11 or later.

References

  • HackerOne Report

low Regular Expression Denial of Service
  • Module: braces
  • Published: February 15th 2019
  • Reported by: Santosh Rao
  • CWE-185
  • Vulnerable: <2.3.1
  • Patched: >=2.3.1
  • Exploitability: 4

Overview

Versions of braces prior to 2.3.1 are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS). Untrusted input may cause catastrophic backtracking while matching regular expressions. This can cause the application to be unresponsive leading to Denial of Service.

Findings

  • karma>expand-braces>braces

Remediation

Upgrade to version 2.3.1 or higher.

References

  • GitHub Commit

moderate Denial of Service
  • Module: js-yaml
  • Published: March 18th 2019
  • Reported by: Shawn Rasheed
  • CWE-400
  • Vulnerable: <3.13.0
  • Patched: >=3.13.0
  • Exploitability: 6

Overview

Versions of js-yaml prior to 3.13.0 are vulnerable to Denial of Service. By parsing a carefully-crafted YAML file, the node process stalls and may exhaust system resources leading to a Denial of Service.

Findings

  • grunt>js-yaml

Remediation

Upgrade to version 3.13.0.

More about this vulnerability
moderate Prototype Pollution
  • Module: jquery
  • Published: April 2nd 2019
  • Reported by: asgerf
  • CWE-471
  • CVE-2019-5428
  • Vulnerable: <3.4.0
  • Patched: >=3.4.0
  • Exploitability: 4

Overview

Versions of jquery prior to 3.4.0 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. The extend() method allows an attacker to modify the prototype for Object causing changes in properties that will exist on all objects.

Findings

  • jquery

Remediation

Upgrade to version 3.4.0 or later.

More about this vulnerability
high Code Injection
  • Module: js-yaml
  • Published: April 10th 2019
  • Reported by: Alex Kocharin
  • CWE-94
  • Vulnerable: <3.13.1
  • Patched: >=3.13.1
  • Exploitability: 5

Overview

Versions of js-yaml prior to 3.13.1 are vulnerable to Code Injection. The load() function may execute arbitrary code injected through a malicious YAML file. Objects that have toString as key, JavaScript code as value and are used as explicit mapping keys allow attackers to execute the supplied code through the load() function. The safeLoad() function is unaffected.

An example payload is { toString: !<tag:yaml.org,2002:js/function> 'function (){return Date.now()}' } : 1 which returns the object { "1553107949161": 1 }

Findings

  • grunt>js-yaml

Remediation

Upgrade to version 3.13.1.

References

  • GitHub PR

More about this vulnerability
high Prototype Pollution
  • Module: lodash
  • Published: July 15th 2019
  • Reported by: Snyk Security Team
  • CWE-471
  • CVE-2019-10744
  • Vulnerable: <4.17.12
  • Patched: >=4.17.12
  • Exploitability: 3

Overview

Versions of lodash before 4.17.12 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. The function defaultsDeep allows a malicious user to modify the prototype of Object via {constructor: {prototype: {...}}} causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.

Findings

  • grunt-karma>lodash
  • grunt-contrib-uglify>lodash

  • grunt>grunt-legacy-util>lodash
  • grunt>lodash
  • gulp>vinyl-fs>glob-watcher>gaze>globule>lodash
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>inquirer>lodash
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>insight>inquirer>lodash
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>lodash

Remediation

Update to version 4.17.12 or later.

More about this vulnerability
high Prototype Pollution
  • Module: handlebars
  • Published: September 16th 2019
  • Reported by: itszn
  • CWE-471
  • CVE-2019-19919
  • Vulnerable: <3.0.8 || >=4.0.0 <4.3.0
  • Patched: >=3.0.8 <4.0.0 || >=4.3.0
  • Exploitability: 6

Overview

Versions of handlebars prior to 3.0.8 or 4.3.0 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution leading to Remote Code Execution. Templates may alter an Objects' __proto__ and __defineGetter__ properties, which may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code through crafted payloads.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>handlebars

Remediation

Upgrade to version 3.0.8, 4.3.0 or later.

References

  • CVE

More about this vulnerability
low Prototype Pollution
  • Module: minimist
  • Published: September 23rd 2019
  • Reported by: Checkmarx Research Team
  • CWE-471
  • Vulnerable: <0.2.1 || >=1.0.0 <1.2.3
  • Patched: >=0.2.1 <1.0.0 || >=1.2.3
  • Exploitability: 1

Overview

Affected versions of minimist are vulnerable to prototype pollution. Arguments are not properly sanitized, allowing an attacker to modify the prototype of Object, causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.
Parsing the argument --__proto__.y=Polluted adds a y property with value Polluted to all objects. The argument --__proto__=Polluted raises and uncaught error and crashes the application.
This is exploitable if attackers have control over the arguments being passed to minimist.

Findings

  • karma>optimist>minimist
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>bower-config>optimist>minimist
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>bower-registry-client>bower-config>optimist>minimist
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>mkdirp>minimist

Remediation

Upgrade to versions 0.2.1, 1.2.3 or later.

References

  • GitHub commit 1
  • GitHub commit 2

More about this vulnerability
high Arbitrary Code Execution
  • Module: handlebars
  • Published: November 14th 2019
  • Reported by: François Lajeunesse-Robert
  • CWE-79
  • Vulnerable: <3.0.8 || >=4.0.0 <4.5.2
  • Patched: >=3.0.8 <4.0.0 || >=4.5.2
  • Exploitability: 6

Overview

Versions of handlebars prior to 3.0.8 or 4.5.2 are vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution. The package's lookup helper fails to properly validate templates, allowing attackers to submit templates that execute arbitrary JavaScript in the system. It can be used to run arbitrary code in a server processing Handlebars templates or on a victim's browser (effectively serving as Cross-Site Scripting).

The following template can be used to demonstrate the vulnerability:

{{#with "constructor"}} {{#with split as |a|}} {{pop (push "alert('Vulnerable Handlebars JS');")}} {{#with (concat (lookup join (slice 0 1)))}} {{#each (slice 2 3)}} {{#with (apply 0 a)}} {{.}} {{/with}} {{/each}} {{/with}} {{/with}} {{/with}}

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>handlebars

Remediation

Upgrade to version 3.0.8, 4.5.2 or later.

More about this vulnerability
high Arbitrary Code Execution
  • Module: handlebars
  • Published: November 18th 2019
  • Reported by: Unknown
  • CWE-79
  • Vulnerable: <3.0.8 || >=4.0.0 <4.5.3
  • Patched: >=3.0.8 <4.0.0 || >=4.5.3
  • Exploitability: 4

Overview

Versions of handlebars prior to 3.0.8 or 4.5.3 are vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution. The package's lookup helper fails to properly validate templates, allowing attackers to submit templates that execute arbitrary JavaScript in the system. It is due to an incomplete fix for a previous issue. This vulnerability can be used to run arbitrary code in a server processing Handlebars templates or on a victim's browser (effectively serving as Cross-Site Scripting).

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>handlebars

Remediation

Upgrade to version 3.0.8, 4.5.3 or later.

More about this vulnerability
high Prototype Pollution
  • Module: handlebars
  • Published: November 18th 2019
  • Reported by: Vladyslav Babkin
  • CWE-471
  • Vulnerable: <3.0.8 || >=4.0.0 <4.5.3
  • Patched: >=3.0.8 <4.0.0 || >=4.5.3
  • Exploitability: 4

Overview

Versions of handlebars prior to 3.0.8 or 4.5.3 are vulnerable to prototype pollution. It is possible to add or modify properties to the Object prototype through a malicious template. This may allow attackers to crash the application or execute Arbitrary Code in specific conditions.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>handlebars

Remediation

Upgrade to version 3.0.8, 4.5.3 or later.

high Insufficient Entropy
  • Module: cryptiles
  • Published: January 23rd 2020
  • Reported by: Unknown
  • CWE-331
  • CVE-2018-1000620
  • Vulnerable: <4.1.2
  • Patched: >=4.1.2
  • Exploitability: 4

Overview

Versions of cryptiles prior to 4.1.2 are vulnerable to Insufficient Entropy. The randomDigits() method does not provide sufficient entropy and its generates digits that are not evenly distributed.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>bower-registry-client>request>hawk>cryptiles
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>request>hawk>cryptiles

Remediation

Upgrade to version 4.1.2. The package is deprecated and has been moved to @hapi/cryptiles and it is strongly recommended to use the maintained package.

  • GitHub PR

high Prototype Pollution Protection Bypass
  • Module: qs
  • Published: February 10th 2020
  • Reported by: Unknown
  • CWE-471
  • CVE-2017-1000048
  • Vulnerable: <6.0.4 || >=6.1.0 <6.1.2 || >=6.2.0 <6.2.3 || >=6.3.0 <6.3.2
  • Patched: >=6.0.4 <6.1.0 || >=6.1.2 <6.2.0 || >=6.2.3 <6.3.0 || >=6.3.2
  • Exploitability: 4

Overview

Affected version of qs are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution because it is possible to bypass the protection. The qs.parse function fails to properly prevent an object's prototype to be altered when parsing arbitrary input. Input containing [ or ] may bypass the prototype pollution protection and alter the Object prototype. This allows attackers to override properties that will exist in all objects, which may lead to Denial of Service or Remote Code Execution in specific circumstances.

Findings

  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>bower-registry-client>request>qs
  • karma-jasmine-jquery>721c59791e751156cab4d4989fb8b9680e71970690a71f2e580cfb866146a0b7>bower>request>qs

Remediation

Upgrade to 6.0.4, 6.1.2, 6.2.3, 6.3.2 or later.

References

  • GitHub Issue
  • Snyk Report

More about this vulnerability
low Prototype Pollution
  • Module: yargs-parser
  • Published: March 26th 2020
  • Reported by: Snyk Security Team
  • CWE-471
  • Vulnerable: <13.1.2 || >=14.0.0 <15.0.1 || >=16.0.0 <18.1.2
  • Patched: >=13.1.2 <14.0.0 || >=15.0.1 <16.0.0 || >=18.1.2
  • Exploitability: 1

Overview

Affected versions of yargs-parser are vulnerable to prototype pollution. Arguments are not properly sanitized, allowing an attacker to modify the prototype of Object, causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.
Parsing the argument --foo.__proto__.bar baz' adds a bar property with value baz to all objects. This is only exploitable if attackers have control over the arguments being passed to yargs-parser.

Findings

  • cpy-cli>meow>yargs-parser

Remediation

Upgrade to versions 13.1.2, 15.0.1, 18.1.1 or later.

References

  • Snyk Report

More about this vulnerability
moderate Cross-Site Scripting
  • Module: jquery
  • Published: April 30th 2020
  • Reported by: Masato Kinugawa
  • CWE-79
  • CVE-2020-11022
  • Vulnerable: <3.5.0
  • Patched: >=3.5.0
  • Exploitability: 3

Overview

Versions of jquery prior to 3.5.0 are vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting. Passing HTML from untrusted sources - even after sanitizing it - to one of jQuery's DOM manipulation methods (i.e. .html(), .append(), and others) may execute arbitrary JavaScript in a victim's browser.

Findings

  • jquery

Remediation

Upgrade to version 3.5.0 or later.

References

  • GitHub Advisory

More about this vulnerability
